attributes.action: DVLA need a telephone customer department that corrects the mistakes they  make
attributes.background:
DVLA fined us for their mistake with our DIrect Debit.
It has been shocking to find they have no telephone service for their mistakes to be sorted out.  Only telephone lines to pay the "fine" even when you don't owe them it. Very stressful time trying to sort it out.

attributes.action: Make Burning The UK Flag a Criminal Offence
attributes.background:
There is a rising problem of protesters in this country thinking that is except able to burn and damage the UK flag in public view. 

This should be made a criminal offence as it can cause great distress and can even motivate people to take violent action against said protesters.
attributes.additional_details:
We should respect OUR flag not burn, rip and trample on it just to make a political point. 

That flag represents us all, as a leading country in this world and as one of the most multi-cultural nations. Whether they like it or not it is the flag of our country and we should not be disrespecting it. 

When they burn and damage that flag they are hurting not only our ancestors but they hurt each and every one of us with every knife that rips it and every flame that licks it.

attributes.action: all petitions with over 200000 signatures put to uk general election style vote
attributes.background:
petitions are often signed and not even discussed in parmlimant this gives the uk public a lack of confidence in the whole petition consept 
if every petition that reached 200000 signatures had to be voted on in an election style vote uk opinons would be voiced from the people for the people
attributes.additional_details:
this concept could be easily implimented by adding all succsesfull petitons to local and or general election questionares forms and voted on the same day reducing cost and increasing likelyhood to vote

the number 200000 is only a ballpar amount of votes if sucsesfull the amount of signature could be agreed upon for less or more but a garuntee of public intrest in the petiton idea would sertainly be sparked because the whole petition basis would have a more definative and resolved end result

attributes.action: Law to change so credit agencies include private rental payments on credit files
attributes.background: There is a natural parallel between monthly rental and mortgage payments that should be recognised by c.r.a. Aiding (private rental)citizens to become home owners escaping the trap/insecurity of private rental aiding contentment optimism and happiness benefiting communities and our broader society.
attributes.additional_details: We have rented privately for 14 years, my partner a lecturer and I an artist. We have 2 children. We have paid our rent on time, in full every month of these 14 years. Each rental payment is a massive percentage of our monthly income, higher than a mortgage would demand. Still this has had no positive implication on our credit rating that has however been negatively impacted by any minimally late utility bill payments. All these years of paying excessive rental payments has only benefitted the landlords and has had no influence on our credit rating that may have allowed us to escape the trap we find ourselves in and find deserved consistency for our family.

attributes.action: Introduce other religious leaders into the house of lords to make it democratic
attributes.background: The only religious leaders in the House of Lords are bishops and arch bishops but as Britain is now a multi faith country other religious leaders from Muslim, Hindu and Sikh (etc) faiths should be entered to the house in order to offer greater representation and democracy and scrutiny in Britain.

attributes.action: Exemption from Immigration Health Surcharge for Marriage visa extension (FLR-M)
attributes.background: Exemption from Immigration Health Surcharge for Marriage visa extension (FLR-M) applications made within the UK from those who are earning more than £35K p.a., who never claimed any kind of benefits, who happen to also have private medical insurance cover for the whole family & hardly use NHS
attributes.additional_details: People earning more than £50K per annum contribute almost £15K per annum in taxes and national insurance. Since 2012, people on spouse visa like me have contributed more than £50K in taxes and national insurance, plus i cannot and have never claimed any benefits, plus i have a private health insurance for my family via my employer which we use the most for any kind of health problem, plus my wife and i have never really used NHS in last 3 years.

attributes.action: Reimburse UK companies of tariffs when trading with the EU, if the UK leaves EU.
attributes.background: If UK left the EU there would be a renegotiation period. In this period companies will need to pay tariffs. This petition is to protect all UK businesses that rely on EU free-trade agreement. This idea would mean UK Government would reimburse UK companies on tariffs, using tariffs received from EU.
attributes.additional_details: With the UK trading at a deficit with the EU, more tariffs will be paid by EU companies to our Government than UK companies to EU Governments. A new Tariff Reimbursement Transition Period could be introduced to help our companies trading with the EU. This will mean our Government reimburses UK companies on tariffs paid to EU Governments using money received in tariffs from EU companies. This would effectively make it free trade for UK companies whilst the UK negotiate free trade deals with EU.

attributes.action: Introduce Dental Receptionists to be registered professionals with the GDC
attributes.background: I believe it's important for all dental receptionists to feel they are as important as registered professionals. Dental receptionists are the first and last point of call for patients.
attributes.additional_details: I also believe that it would give dental receptionists a higher profile and feel important to the dental team. I have spoken to a dental receptionist and she has stated that she believes it's important for these changes to be made as it would benefit the dental services and feels it would have a positive impact on dental receptionists to feel as important as the rest of the dental team.  I believe that they should be registered with the general dental council to have a responsibility for keeping up to date with standards and prove that they are continuing personal development but also be accountable for their actions.

attributes.action: Allow pharmacists to have basic prescribing rights for minor illnesses
attributes.background: Pharmacists already play a vital role in the local community. On the continent pharmacists play an active role by prescribing antibiotics for minor illnesses and providing emergency prescriptions. In England we face increasing pressures on A&E and GP primary care we ask the UK government to discuss
attributes.additional_details:
There is growing evidence that commissioning pharmacists to undertake basic prescribing duties will ease significant NHS challenges. such as :
- A & E pressures
- GP pressures 

In Spain and Portugal ( amongst other counties ) pharmacists provide a walk-in service where they will consult and issue prescriptions for more minor illnesses, and yet, in the UK we under estimate the resource we have available. 
www.pharmacymagazine.co.uk/let-us-prescribe-to-help-the-nhs

attributes.action: Refer Amazon to the competition authorities.
attributes.background: In The Telegraph interview Rohan Silva, a former adviser to David Cameron and George Osborne, said the lack of competition in the book market is “really horrifying”, allowing Amazon to dominate.I’m absolutely aghast about what the government and competition authorities have allowed Amazon to do.
attributes.additional_details:
What the Society of Authors and their memebers think of Amazon can be found here: http://www.societyofauthors.org/what-do-we-think-amazon

The background to this petition can be found at this link: http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/shopping-and-consumer-news/12167545/Government-must-help-end-heartbreaking-Amazon-dominance-former-Number-10-adviser-says.html?WT.mc_id=e_DM89475&WT.tsrc=email&etype=Edi_Pol_New_EU&utm_source=email&utm_medium=Edi_Pol_New_EU_2016_02_22&utm_campaign=DM89475

attributes.action: Make it illegal for farmers and food producers to use antibiotics routinely.
attributes.background: Antibiotic resistance is a major health problem. Much is caused by routine feeding or injecting of livestock to improve yields. This has stopped many antibiotics from working causing dangerous patient health issues and increased NHS costs. This resistance threatens ALL antibiotic effectiveness.
attributes.additional_details: While there might be occasions when farm animals need antibiotics to treat specific illnesses, the wholesale use can only increase the risk of the evolution of resistant bacterial strains with fatal human consequences.

attributes.action: Penalties against custodians turning away people accompanied by Assistance Dogs
attributes.background: Access discrimination to become a criminal offence with hefty statuatory fines put in place with further offenses increasing the fines given and lead to liquor, transport, or trading license being revoked
attributes.additional_details:
Across the UK, there are currently over 6,700 disabled and impaired people who have become the recipient of Assistance Dogs, specially trained to help them so that their disability is less of the daily burden it was before.
In 2010 the Government abolished the Disability Discrimination Act 1995, replacing it with the Equality Act 2010. This Act is insufficient in making companies fall in line with such procedures. This must be addressed with penalties put in place for non-compliance.

attributes.action: Agree never to sell or give our NHS details to anyone outside the NHS.
attributes.background: Apparently this proposal is back again. There is a proposal to sell all our details to the private sector. This was defeated once and needs to be defeated again. Let's get it debated in Parliament.

attributes.action: Force advertisers to label manipulated images and provide link to original media
attributes.background: Our children and young adults are surrounded by media portraying unnatural and mostly unattainable body images. In many cases that media has been considerably digitally manipulated (eg, airbrushing) and I propose legislation for such images to include a link to the original unenhanced image.
attributes.additional_details: Many studies and reports show the negative effect on our younger generation of being constantly subjected to images of such extreme and artificial body images. By forcing the producers of such media to include a link to the original image (by way of, say, a reference number or QR code or similar) the media would be more transparent to such harmful image manipulation.

attributes.action: Teach sea safety in all costal schools.
attributes.background: We should make it mandatory for all costal schools to teach their pupils about sea safety, as they do in Australia, this information has the potential to save many many lives and should be taught in schools.
attributes.additional_details: Many people each year find themselves stuck in rip tides, most of which in this country have no idea of what a rip tide is, never mind what to do if ever caught in one, there is plenty of life saving information out there and without this information the worst could happen. In Australia most if not all children in costal school are taught about the dangers of the sea and how they could potentially avoid it, we should take note from this and apply it to our own schools, potentially saving lives.

attributes.action: Reduce the six week school holidays.
attributes.background: We are now in 2016 which is a different era from times gone by.  Parents work not every parent can rely on free childcare or assistance from grandparents.  When a child is away from school for such a long time it is a detriment to any educational development.
attributes.additional_details: Children go back to school forgetting what they have learned in the previous term.  Many children are not physically active and spend the six week holidays inactive.  Childcare is very expensive children expect to do activities which unfortunately very rarely are free.  Family life is stressful due to the time scale and general cost.  Holidays abroad double.  Time with family is important but we need to look at an agenda which helps parents rather than hinders.  If the holidays are going to continue there needs to be a scheme to aid parents.

attributes.action: To Criminalize Ticket buying bots from buying up tickets for events
attributes.background: Ticket Buying bots should be criminalized and the practice made illegal. botnets are programmes which are used to target ticketing agents. They buy tickets at high speed and stop fans from being able to buy tickets at face value the tickets are then resold on other sites at greater value
attributes.additional_details:
For Example Harry potter tickets £15 pounds per part on the official website 
Stubhub ticket web site anything from £150 - £1750

attributes.action: Stop Housing Associations charging more than social rent on their properties.
attributes.background: My 20 years old has a 1 bedroom Circle 33 Housing Association property and her rent in £189.00 per week.  Another Circle property 2 minutes away is £129.00 p/w. She is under so much stress and anxiety worrying about getting work and paying her rent and not ending up homeless.
attributes.additional_details: She will have to claim a portion of Housing Benefit as she will not be in a position to pay it all herself.  Surely if the rent was lowered there would be smaller claims for Housing Benefit, possibly no claims at all in some circumstances being made. Surely it is common sense to reduce the rent to reduce the amount of Housing Benefit claims being made.  There is nothing included the £189.00 rent, e.g. water rates or care taking facilities.

attributes.action: Revise self defence laws in the UK and bring back handgun ownership.
attributes.background: Enough people are dead in Europe and the time to act is upon us. GCHQ has done an amazing job at preventing terror attacks in the UK but the police cannot possibly act fast enough to save us all in case of attack by terror groups. We propose a government measure to allow civilians to keep handguns.
attributes.additional_details:
The five or six consecutive terror attacks in Europe prior to this date.

The brave US police officer who fought with the Orlando shooter to delay his spree and save hundreds.

A Switzerland style gun law attitude or Israel style will work. People in Europe are applying for gun permits in droves and can only use those guns to defend themselves at home and left defenceless in the streets.

attributes.action: Relax the rules on appearance to allow service personnel to blend in more.
attributes.background: After recent attempted kidnapping of a serviceman I think it's time that the rules governing appearance and grooming should be permanently relaxed to allow serviceman appear to be a member of public.

attributes.action: Incentivise businesses to increase the number of Standing Desks for employees
attributes.background: Employees spend 40+ hours a week at their desks, the lack of movement is a key problem in the obesity pandemic. Introducing standing desks DRAMATICALLY reduces this and the chances of type II diabetes. Getting businesses to bring in standing desks will help make Britain healthier. We need guidelines
attributes.additional_details:
Some of the benefits of standing desks have been ratified by research conducted in the States and in Britain. According to the researchers 'Sitting is the new smoking'. 

Below are some articles which list the benefits:

http://www.smithsonianmag.com/science-nature/five-health-benefits-standing-desks-180950259/?no-ist
https://authoritynutrition.com/7-benefits-of-a-standing-desk

attributes.action: Make Bullying illegal in the UK
attributes.background: Children are being permanently damaged but the affect of bullying it is morally wrong we as the people should be more vigilant in protecting our youth from the pain and forever damage bullying causes bullying needs to be illegal in all of its area from the simple name calling to the abuse
attributes.additional_details:
a on going debate on whether it should be illegal http://www.debate.org/opinions/should-bullying-be-illegal

http://www.teenink.com/opinion/school_college/article/331577/Should-There-Be-a-Law-Against-Bullying/

attributes.action:
Car Tax Refund takes too long
Should be immediate from the day car sold
attributes.background:
There is no period of grace buying a car to taxing it The DVLA obtain immediate monies
Refund from selling a car takes up to 6 weeks.
You only get the refund from the following full month. That means there is an awful lot of surplus cash sitting somewhere. 
This practice needs to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details:
If a bank held onto our cash without letting us have our money there would be an outcry. Why should the DVLA hold onto our money.
As soon as a car is taxed online the DVLA must be made to give an immediate refund on the car that has been sold. Money is taken electronically therefore should be refunded electronically.

attributes.action: We demand a response to the killing of African Americans by the U.S police.
attributes.background: Following the murders of Philando Castile and Alton Sterling, we demand an official response from Her Majesty’s Government in parliament and international pressure on the US Government, the US Congress and the US Department of Justice to reform its gun laws and police use of deadly force.
attributes.additional_details:
Over the years, investigations into the high profile police killings of the following victims have yielded no police convictions:
Mike Brown (unarmed, shot whilst complying with police orders)
Tamir Rice (12 year old shot without question for holding a toy gun)
Eric Garner (unarmed, choked to death)
Rekia Boyd (unarmed girl, shot without warning in the head)
Amadou Diallo (unarmed, shot 41 times)
Sean Bell (unarmed, shot 50 times on his wedding day)
Kimani Gray
Freddie Gray

attributes.action: Ban Air Guns
attributes.background: After a ricochet I was shot in the eye with an air pistol over 50 years ago and still being treated for the after effects, it has left me with partial sight that causes problems to this day.

attributes.action: Protect the public sector from future Private Finance Initiatives (PFI)
attributes.background: PFI’s charge on average 15% interest pa for 30 years. We propose that all future public sector infrastructure projects should be paid for through Public Finance Initiative Bonds (PFIB’s) where members of the general public could invest via the post office into PFIB’s in return for a 5% interest p.a.
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS is currently paying £3,729 every minute to private companies as part of an annual repayment fee for building and operating new hospitals or redeveloping old ones.
PFIBs could replace PFIs and be similar to National savings bonds where the general public deposit money (say a minimum £1,000 for a minimum of 5 years) via the post office into a PFIB this would be used to build future public infrastructure projects. Even allowing for 5% operating costs this would reduce our costs by over 25%

attributes.action: Make a 1471 type phone service to report scam calls and block offending numbers.
attributes.background: We're all open to scam phone calls e.g. from 'Microsoft fraud dept' wanting to connect to my PC so they can 'delete a virus'. At the moment, we have to be reactive to these calls and can only spread the word on Facebook, emails etc to warn others but what if we could all help to actually stop them?
attributes.additional_details: When you get a call, you can dial 1471 to get the last callers number. I want to get the phone companies to take collective action to create an easier way to report and block scammers. My idea would be free service that, after getting a scam call, you could dial a 4 digit number, like you do with 1471. This would report the last callers as a scammer. If this number gets over a certain number of reports, it could then be blocked.

attributes.action: NO guarantee for EU nationals in UK without equality for Brits in EU.
attributes.background: Brits were encouraged for 30 years to invest in EU by buying houses for their retirement in a favourable climate for their health. Is it the wish of the British people for over a million UK pensioners to lose everything they have worked for all their lives?

attributes.action: Promise to match EU spending within the UK in the event of Brexit.
attributes.background: A large part of the campaign to leave the EU was based on the fact that the UK is a net contributor to the EU funds. We contribute £12.9bn a year (gross) or £7.1bn a year (net). In the event of Brexit, we would ask the government to maintain the level of investment in the UK that the EU contributed.
attributes.additional_details: The EU contributed £5.2bn a year to the UK, by various mechanisms. Given that in the event of Britain leaving the EU we will not be paying membership fees, we would ask that the government promise to maintain the payments that would have been made by the EU. This will, for example, protect vulnerable areas of the UK by matching the funding they would have received from the European development fund.

attributes.action: Amend MP's Oath to include a commitment to Nolan's 7 principles of public life
attributes.background: Nolan's 7 principles of public life (selflessness, integrity, objectivity, accountability, openness, honesty & leadership) are in Ministerial Code as a conduct guide, but should be made key and an explicit commitment for MPs.  The Oath MP's swear should include a promise to uphold the principles.
attributes.additional_details: Nolan's 7 principles of public life: www.gov.uk/government/publications/the-7-principles-of-public-life

attributes.action: A general election to be held when the Prime Minister David Cameron steps down.
attributes.background: This petition is to demand that a general election be held when the Prime Minister David Cameron steps down as Prime Minister. It is not right that a different Conservative candidate be given this position of power without winning a general election.
attributes.additional_details: It is only fair to the people of the United Kingdom that we be allowed a general election to elect our new Prime Minister when Mr Cameron officially leaves his post.

attributes.action: Theresa May must apologise for policies developed while Home Secretary
attributes.background: She should apologise to thousands of wrongfully deported students. She should apologise to non-EU spouses who had to leave the UK because their partner earned under £18,600. She should apologise to Tier 2 skilled workers being forced to leave the UK for earning under £35k, and their families.
attributes.additional_details:
She has refused to release court records that prove the students were wrongfully deported. She refused to prosecute high-profile journalists accused of phone hacking, one of which worked for the Government. She tried to ban WhatsApp.

She introduced laws that mean 36% of migrant primary teachers and 9% of migrant senior school teachers will be forced to leave the UK, due to the Tier 2 settlement threshold of £35k.

She opposes the Equality Act 2010. She has argued against the Human Rights Act.

attributes.action: Introduce licenses for pet ownership
attributes.background: More and more pets are going missing as well as stolen. As well as this, dog fighting is still in existence. By introducing licenses we can reduce this and know that pets are in a safe home through the checks owners must go through to own any animal.
attributes.additional_details: I run a group on Facebook and everyday there are more missing pets. Dog fighting still exists and in a recent report it has stated dog fighting happened every day. Licenses will require the owner to pass simple knowledge and possibly even annual checks to be sure the pet is safe. This would work well with a register listing all animal abusers so they do not hurt an animal again as they wont have a license to buy pets. In addition stop the ban on the four dogs. With responsible owners these dogs do not need to be banned.

attributes.action: Until Brexit Article 50 details are agreed, plans for HS2 should be put on hold.
attributes.background: The UK is undergoing considerable economic and financial strain. As this situation will continue, at least, until such time as all the EU severance details (Article 50) are worked through, the UK Government should put an immediate stop and hold on any further development of the HS2 project.

attributes.action: Make MP's like us: 93% state school; 50% women; 100% from their constituency.
attributes.background: The country is economically and politically divided. MP's are bewildered by those outside London because they are so different from them. Let's break the domination of private school educated, London based men in our politics. Bring in quotas now for our representatives so MP's look like us.
attributes.additional_details:
50% of the population are women. Women got the vote a hundred years ago and still they are under represented and under paid in every walk of life.
7% of the population are private school educated and yet they make up to 50% of MP's in government. 
Career politicians live and work in London and do not understand the people they represent. 
These three problems can be solved by the next General Election. Let's make MP's more like us and bring in quotas for a fairer, less divided, United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Cross-party statement condemning hate crimes & a debate on firmer punishments
attributes.background: Since the referendum people have been using the result as an opportunity to express racism and hate. This is to ask all political parties and politicians to come together on a joint statement to stand united against racism and hate. Also to ask for a debate on firmer punishments for hate crimes.
attributes.additional_details: This is NOT about how people voted. It's about it being used as an excuse.

attributes.action: Potential employers must contact the applicant whether they're accepted or not
attributes.background: I've applied to jobs and although I have one currently, too many people will apply to jobs and receive no no input from the potential employer. To be forced to wait 2 weeks for a job you might not get, to be told you haven't got it after that waiting period is needed.

attributes.action: A Judicial Review on the exclusion of 16 to 18 year olds from the EU Referendum
attributes.background: The Scottish Referendum allowed 16 to 18 year olds to vote but the EU Referendum, which impacts the young disproportionately, did not. This decision was seemingly  based on cost considerations not on the legal precedence that has been set.

attributes.action:
Non Negotiable for BREXIT
No free movement for work, NO free NHS, No Benefits.
attributes.background: Our local communities are getting destroyed by these mass unskilled EU immigration which is putting pressure on schools, NHS. housing, work and more important our quality of life. We want immigration which we need to progress in the world. We cant open borders for abuse by EU migrants for benefits.
attributes.additional_details:
The country has voted to LEAVE the EU due to David Cameron's failure and promise to renegotiate with the EU and all the key basic requirements been watered down.

We now want the any future UK Govt to respect and honour the wishes of British people to renegotiate with the EU on the basis of referendum with (Non Negotiable for BREXIT)
No free movement for work, NO free NHS, No access to any benefits.

We dont want future UK Govt to water down these main issues for other concessions from the EU.

attributes.action: Greater devolution of powers to Greater London - like Scotland, NI and Wales
attributes.background: Considering the size of London's population and the unique challenges it faces, London should have a similar say in these matters, with further powers devolved to the London Assembly and London given more control over its finances to focus on its own priorities.
attributes.additional_details:
Greater London is economically and socially distinct from England. We know this from recent polls and elections.

Areas with smaller populations and economies (London's being larger than many European nations) have gained powers through devolution, e.g. the Northern Ireland Assembly, Scottish Parliament and National Assembly of Wales. They are responsible for areas such as infrastructure, health and education as these countries are best suited to make their own decisions within their borders.

attributes.action: Hold binding referenda in cities/regions to vote on independence from the UK.
attributes.background: Post EU referendum 49% of the voting population are unhappy with the result. 2 countries and many large cities voted to stay, there is a massive divide in the politics, with fundamentally opposed ideas. The UK should allow these regions to vote on independence from the UK in binding referenda.
attributes.additional_details:
Given the uncertainty and issues that will arise from leaving the EU and new political leadership. We should seriously consider the alternative options available if cities or regions were to vote for independence and remain in the EU.

https://ig.ft.com/sites/elections/2016/uk/eu-referendum/
http://www.newsweek.com/london-sadiq-khan-brexit-londependence-independence-referendum-474356
http://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-36616028
http://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36626201

attributes.action: Rerun the EU referendum with compulsory voting and reduce the voting age to 16.
attributes.background: The decision to leave or remain in the EU is one that will affect every person in this country. As such this decision requires agreement from every single member of the population to ensure that we make the right choice. This includes those aged 16 -17 who were allowed their say in similar referenda
attributes.additional_details: The recent EU referendum discriminates against the youth based on the precedent of being allowed to vote at 16+ in the Scottish Referendum. There are also those who did not vote in the recent referendum who may now wish to add their voice to whether to remain or leave the EU. Considering the closeness of the result. A compulsory vote of all citizens aged 16+ is required to settle this issue once and for all with full agreement of the population as its implications affects all citizens.

attributes.action: Create independent body to call re-elections if campaign promises are not kept
attributes.background:
Create an independent body to call snap elections/referendums, protecting our right to Democratic representation

Reverse the current trend of politicians basing campaigns on promises publicised to secure votes, then immediately discarded

Key promises must be identified+independently monitored
attributes.additional_details:
The Leave campaign's pre-vote promises: 
https://goo.gl/DuYSZg

4 key promises retracted in first 24 hours: https://goo.gl/i83HYK

9 key pre-election promises broken by Tory Gov't in 1st 100 days: http://goo.gl/ZkgEqa

More pre-election promises immediately discarded: http://goo.gl/H3pnZM

If we are unable to vote on issues we want represented then we do not live in a functioning democracy

Intentions should be clearly stated as separate from promises. Promises should include dates for review

attributes.action: Create a TV advert explaining to people who voted remain how democracy works.
attributes.background: It has become clear since the referendum result was announced that a significant number of the population do not understand how the democratic process works. This is an issue which a skilfully crafted TV advert will help to address.

attributes.action: Change how the UK is governed to better serve and protect the British public.
attributes.background: Currently the key decision makers in the UK in the House of Lords are un-elected. They are appointed by being vetted by the Appointments Commission, then approved by the prime minister and formalised by the Queen. We feel that all aspects of our Government, especially key members should be elected.
attributes.additional_details:
We demand that:

All members of the House of Lords are appointed by the public's vote only and each members term is subjected to a vote every 5 years.

If voted out, their position is to be replaced by a member elected by public vote.

Membership is to open to all current and former MP's.
 
If a MP is currently serving when elected to the House of Lords, their local position is to be replaced by a member of their own party. This member is to be elected by the people in their constituency only.

attributes.action: Improve the representation of the British people in the UK parliament.
attributes.background:
We ask that parliament gives the British people a yes/no referendum on this question by June 2019:

“Do you want the UK to have an elected second house to represent the regional needs of the British people and proportional representation in the House of Commons to form all future governments?
attributes.additional_details:
There has been a growing need for reform of our democratic system for the last few decades. 

We feel that this is needed to improve communication between the political elite and the British people and to make our democracy more representative of the full spectrum of the view points held by our citizens.

attributes.action: Lower the voting age in referendums to 15 and elections to 16.
attributes.background: After the EU referendum I felt powerless to say my opinion because I am too young to vote. However many people at my school have a very large knowledge and definitely would've voted if they had the chance too. The people that these referendums impact the most aren't allowed to put forward their say.

attributes.action: Work with the Commonwealth of Nations to establish an economic union
attributes.background: We call upon Her Majesty, the government and the British Parliament to actively seek cooperation with other commonwealth countries to establish a strong union/community that promotes greater social, political & economic harmony amongst those countries we have a strong historical relationships with.
attributes.additional_details: The people of the UK have voted to leave the EU, which will cause a huge economic impact. This vote is influenced by strong concerns regarding the legitimacy of a democratic mandate within the European Commission. There are also many constitutional questions this raises in terms of future arrangements between nations within the UK such as Scottish autonomy & Northern Ireland's relationship with Ireland. Commonwealth countries have already endorsed seeking free trade between commonwealth members.

attributes.action: Debate the legality of denying EU migrants the vote in the EU Ref.
attributes.background: Denying EU migrants, on the electoral roll, the right to vote in the EU referendum contravenes EU law (enshrined in the TFEU, Part 2) on non-discrimination based on nationality.
attributes.additional_details: The outcome of the EU referendum has an impact on the lives of non-British nationals resident in the UK. It will also impact on the lives of their families and children. Consequently they should have the right to vote.

attributes.action: Block George Osborne's emergency budget proposal, if Britain leaves the EU
attributes.background: George Osborne has announced that if Britain leaves the EU, he will be forced to raise taxes and cut spending to prevent an economic meltdown. Not only is the 'evidence' used to suggest this just based on wild predictions and scaremongering, but it also contradicts the 2015 conservative manifesto.
